programme.title: Out of Time

programme.title: The New World
programme.desc: Explorer John Smith (Colin Farrell) lands in 17th-century North America.

programme.title: A Most Violent Year
programme.desc: In 1981 New York, a fuel supplier (Oscar Isaac) tries to adhere to his own moral compass amid the rampant violence, corruption and decay that threaten his family and his business.

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: A CIA operative (Leonardo DiCaprio) hatches a dangerous plan to catch the leader of a terrorist organization, but conflicts with his two closest allies (Russell Crowe, Mark Strong) may cost him his life.

programme.title: Gemini
programme.desc: A heinous crime tests the complex relationship between a Hollywood starlet and her tenacious personal assistant. As the assistant unravels the mystery, she must confront her own understanding of friendship, truth and celebrity.

programme.title: Revenge of the Green Dragons
programme.desc: A Chinese emigrant (Justin Chon) and his best friend (Kevin Wu) rise through the ranks of one of New York's most-powerful street gangs.

programme.title: Victor Frankenstein

programme.title: Wes Craven Presents: Dracula 2000
programme.desc: A London antiques dealer (Christopher Plummer) travels to New Orleans to save his estranged daughter from his nemesis, Count Dracula (Gerard Butler).

programme.title: Into the Forest
programme.desc: In the wilds of the Pacific Northwest, two sisters must fight for survival after an apocalyptic blackout leaves them without gas, water, electricity or cellphones.

programme.title: The Pink Panther Strikes Again

programme.desc: Eight years after a child disappeared without a trace, detectives find disturbing clues that indicate that the girl is still alive.

programme.title: The Box
programme.desc: A husband (James Marsden) and wife (Cameron Diaz) receive a simple wooden box which will grant them $1 million, but simultaneously, it will cause the death of someone elsewhere in the world.

programme.title: The Bourne Ultimatum
programme.desc: Jason Bourne (Matt Damon) continues his international quest to uncover his true identity while staying one step ahead of those who want to kill him.

programme.title: Dracula II: Ascension
programme.desc: A vampire hunter (Jason Scott Lee) goes in search of medical students who hope to distill the key to immortality from the body of Dracula.

programme.title: The Upside of Anger
programme.desc: An ex-ballplayer (Kevin Costner) befriends a mother (Joan Allen) of four who has hovered in a boozy funk since her husband abandoned her.

programme.title: Talk Black
programme.desc: A timid engineer develops a wild and expressive split personality that helps her stand up to male co-workers.

programme.title: Backstabbing for Beginners
programme.desc: Based on a true story, an idealistic young employee at the U.N. investigates the grizzly murder of his predecessor -- uncovering a vast global conspiracy that may involve his own boss.

programme.title: Obvious Child
programme.desc: An immature, newly unemployed comic (Jenny Slate) must navigate the murky waters of adulthood after her fling with a graduate student (Jake Lacy) results in an unplanned pregnancy.

programme.title: Dim Sum Funeral
programme.desc: The grown children of an overbearing Chinese matriarch reluctantly gather to take part in seven days' worth of traditional funeral rites.

programme.title: Elizabethtown
programme.desc: In Kentucky to bury his father, a troubled man (Orlando Bloom) gets his life on track with the help of a free-spirited flight attendant (Kirsten Dunst).

programme.title: The Lovely Bones
programme.desc: A 14-year-old murder victim watches from heaven, as her family tries to heal and her killer continues on his own dark path.

programme.title: Cirque du Freak: The Vampire's Assistant
programme.desc: After a sideshow vampire (John C. Reilly) turns a teenager into one of the undead, the kid becomes a pawn between warring supernatural factions.

programme.title: Philomena
programme.desc: Journalist Martin Sixsmith (Steve Coogan) helps Philomena Lee (Judi Dench) search for her long-lost son, who was taken from her by nuns in an Irish convent and sold into adoption when she was an unwed teenager.

programme.title: Luce
programme.desc: A liberal-minded couple are forced to reconsider their image of their adopted son after he writes a disturbing essay for a class assignment.

programme.title: Fast Color
programme.desc: Hunted by mysterious forces, a woman with supernatural abilities must go on the run. With nowhere else to go, she goes back to her estranged family and the farmhouse she abandoned long ago.

programme.title: Aliens
programme.desc: On planet LV-426, Ripley (Sigourney Weaver) and a dwindling number of Marines battle an almost-unstoppable army of monstrous predators which wiped out an entire colony of humans, save for one little girl (Carrie Henn).

programme.title: XXX
programme.desc: A government agent (Samuel L. Jackson) recruits an athlete (Vin Diesel) to stop an anarchist from using biological and chemical weapons.

programme.title: XXX: State of the Union
programme.desc: In Washington, D.C., the new XXX agent (Ice Cube) must eliminate a threat to the president from within the U.S. government.

programme.title: Line of Duty
programme.desc: FBI agents Bobby (Jeremy Ray Valdez) and Julian (Will Rothhaar) infiltrate a drug cartel run by Jason (Walter Perez) and Derek (Joseph Julian Soria), their childhood friends.

programme.title: Line of Duty
programme.desc: FBI agents Bobby (Jeremy Ray Valdez) and Julian (Will Rothhaar) infiltrate a drug cartel run by Jason (Walter Perez) and Derek (Joseph Julian Soria), their childhood friends.

programme.title: Leatherheads
programme.desc: A 1920s football star (George Clooney) tries to give his sagging sport a boost, while he and a new teammate (John Krasinski) vie for the affections of a feisty newswoman (Renée Zellweger).

programme.title: Lean on Pete
programme.desc: Charley, a teen living with his single father, finds work caring for an aging racehorse named Lean on Pete. When he learns Pete is bound for slaughter, the two embark on an odyssey across the new American frontier in search of a place to call home.

programme.title: Pawn Sacrifice
programme.desc: American chess legend Bobby Fischer (Tobey Maguire) and Soviet Grandmaster Boris Spassky (Liev Schreiber) enthrall the world with their intense battle of wills and strategy during the 1972 World Chess Championship.

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: A battle of wills breaks out when a working-class woman (Amy Poehler) moves in with the high-powered executive (Tina Fey) who hired her to be a surrogate mother.

programme.title: Vacation
programme.desc: Following in his father's (Chevy Chase) footsteps, Rusty Griswold (Ed Helms) takes his wife (Christina Applegate) and two sons on a cross-country road trip to America's favorite fun park, Walley World.

programme.title: Get Hard
programme.desc: The prison-bound manager (Will Ferrell) of a hedge fund asks a black businessman (Kevin Hart) -- who has never been to jail -- to prepare him for life behind bars.

programme.title: Road House
programme.desc: Hired to tame a rowdy Missouri bar, a Ph.D. bouncer (Patrick Swayze) romances a doctor (Kelly Lynch) and tames the whole town.

programme.title: The Last Stand
programme.desc: A sheriff (Arnold Schwarzenegger) must take matters into his own hands when a notorious drug lord escapes from FBI custody and comes speeding toward a showdown in the lawman's quiet border town.

programme.title: The Other Side of the Door
programme.desc: A grieving mother (Sarah Wayne Callies) upsets the balance between life and death when she opens an ancient door that releases the restless spirit of her deceased son (Logan Creran).

programme.title: Insidious: Chapter 3
programme.desc: Psychic Elise Rainier (Lin Shaye) reluctantly agrees to use her ability to converse with the dead to help a teenage girl (Stefanie Scott) who is being tormented by a dangerous supernatural entity.

programme.title: Climax
programme.desc: When members of a dance troupe are lured to an empty school, drug-laced sangria causes their jubilant rehearsal to descend into a dark and explosive nightmare as they try to survive the night -- and find out who's responsible -- before it's too late.

programme.title: Slice
programme.desc: In a spooky small town, when a slew of pizza delivery boys are slain on the job, two daring survivors set out to catch the culprits behind the cryptic crime spree.

programme.title: Tears of the Sun
programme.desc: A Navy SEAL (Bruce Willis) and his squad try to protect a doctor (Monica Bellucci) and Nigerian refugees from ruthless rebels.

programme.title: Extortion
programme.desc: A family stranded on an island in the Bahamas believe it is being rescued by two fishermen but come to realize it is being held hostage until it hands over $1 million.

programme.title: Extortion
programme.desc: A family stranded on an island in the Bahamas believe it is being rescued by two fishermen but come to realize it is being held hostage until it hands over $1 million.

programme.title: Yes Man
programme.desc: After attending a self-help seminar, a negative-thinking man (Jim Carrey) brings about an amazing change in his life by saying yes to everything.

programme.title: The Upside of Anger
programme.desc: An ex-ballplayer (Kevin Costner) befriends a mother (Joan Allen) of four who has hovered in a boozy funk since her husband abandoned her.

programme.title: Pure
programme.desc: An insecure girl grapples with fears of embracing her sexuality.

programme.title: Room
programme.desc: Held captive for years in an enclosed space, a woman (Brie Larson) and her young son (Jacob Tremblay) finally gain their freedom, allowing the boy to experience the outside world for the first time.

programme.title: The Manchurian Candidate
programme.desc: A troubled Gulf War veteran (Denzel Washington) becomes suspicious after a powerful senator's (Meryl Streep) son (Liev Schreiber) becomes a candidate for vice president.

programme.title: Rescue Dawn
programme.desc: During the Vietnam War, Dieter Dengler (Christian Bale), a U.S. fighter pilot, is shot down over Laos and taken captive by enemy soldiers.

programme.title: Don't Let Go
programme.desc: Detective Jack Radcliff gets a shocking phone call from his recently murdered niece Ashley. Working together across time, they race to solve the crime before it can happen.

programme.title: Hellboy II: The Golden Army
programme.desc: Hellboy (Ron Perlman) and his team face an underworld prince who plans to awaken a lethal army and use it to reclaim Earth for his magical kindred.

programme.title: Carrie
programme.desc: Tormented by her peers and sheltered by her religious mother (Julianne Moore), an awkward teenager (Chloë Grace Moretz) unleashes her hidden, telekinetic powers after a sick prank at her senior prom pushes her over the edge.

programme.title: A Prayer Before Dawn
programme.desc: The amazing true story of Billy Moore, an English boxer incarcerated in Thailand's most notorious prison. Thrown into a world of drugs and violence, he finds his best chance to escape is to fight his way out in Muay Thai tournaments.

programme.title: Never Goin' Back
programme.desc: Angela and Jessie are best friends intent on taking a wild beach trip, but when their roommate loses all of their money in a drug scam, the girls -- blissfully stoned -- go to increasingly daring and absurd lengths to get it back.

programme.title: The Adderall Diaries
programme.desc: Suffering from writer's block, author Stephen Elliott (James Franco) reconnects with his estranged father (Ed Harris) while investigating the murder case of computer entrepreneur Hans Reiser (Christian Slater).

programme.title: Woman Walks Ahead
programme.desc: A headstrong New York painter embarks on a dangerous journey to meet Sitting Bull but must face off with an Army officer intent on war with the Native Americans.

programme.title: Music Within
programme.desc: After losing most of his hearing in the Vietnam War, Richard Pimentel (Ron Livingston) becomes a motivational speaker and a driving force behind the Americans With Disabilities Act.

programme.title: Runs Good
programme.desc: What was supposed to be an unfinished project feels more like a mechanic special; with problem after problem, it looks like this car was closer to ending up in a landfill than laying down 11s leaving the car meet.

programme.desc: After a sideshow vampire (John C. Reilly) turns a teenager into one of the undead, the kid becomes a pawn between warring supernatural factions.
